alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Kauai North; Koolau Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 15 at 3:39PM HST until January 18 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .Surf will trend up tonight along north and west facing shores as a small to moderate, medium-period northwest (310-320 deg) swell builds down the island chain. As this swell peaks later tonight, a more significant north-northwest (350 deg) swell is forecast to drive surf to advisory levels Tuesday as it peaks. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Surf building to 15 to 20 feet. * WHERE...North facing shores of Kauai, Maui, Molokai, Niihau, Oahu and the Big Island. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
